p.s: Many britishBritish people speak only English.

In connection to this topic John Worne wrote an article, where he says that the UK has a problem.
But is it a real problem that they speak only English?
At least English is the world language.
In my oppinionopinion the author mentioned convincing arguments and examples.
But I do not agree with him totally.
Because of the globalisation English becomes more and more important.
The huge majority learns English at school, at least in the industry countries.

Worne describes also counter-arguments.
For instance your phone can translate for you.
He replies that you need roaming data for that.
I think that this is a very bad and weak answer.
Yes, you can translate with your phone.
But do you want that?
You say something into your phone and your opposite do that too.
In my oppinionopinion direct communication is better than indirect communication with your phone.
Now we come to the key sentence of Worne.
He thinks that language learning is vital for theUK's future prosperity and global standing.
I cannot agree with him at every point.
Language learning is important and has many advantages, that are mentioned before.
But the risks are not that high.
The UK's prosperity is not in danger.
The UK's future is not in danger because of not learning languages.
The Brexit is another topic.
But for the global standing it would be desirable to learn foreign languages.
The fact, that the author does not name documentary evidence that the UK's future or prosperity is endangerendangered is quite noticeable.
